intro: Endolepis phyllostegia, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. Endolepis phyllostegia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
